models.person module

module:

models.person

synopsis:

Base Person entity with simple validation and a mutable email property.

This module defines the Person class used as a base for other domain models. It validates/normalizes name, age, and email, exposes a property for email, and provides a tiny helper to serialize common fields.

Notes

  • Validation/normalization helpers live in src.validation.validators.

  • Kept intentionally small for the lab. No fancy ORM stuff here.

class models.person.Person(name: str, age: int, email: str)[source]

Bases: object

Simple person record with name, age, and email (normalized).

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Person’s name (validated, then normalized).

  • age (int) – Non-negative integer age.

  • email (str) – Email address (validated, then normalized).

name

Normalized person name.

Type:

str

age

Integer age (stored as int explicitly).

Type:

int

_email

Backing field for the public email property.

Type:

str

Notes

  • __slots__ used to save memory and avoid accidental attributes.

  • Email is exposed via a property so we can re-validate on update.

age
property email: str

Email getter.

Returns:

The (normalized) email string.

Return type:

str

introduce() → str[source]

Return and print a small intro string (lab-style helper).

Returns:

A message of the form: "Hi, I'm <name>. I am <age> years old. Please find attached my email address if you wish to contact me: <email>"

Return type:

str

Notes

  • Also prints to stdout because it’s handy for quick manual checks.
